meanings.sent1: The loud noise from the fireworks did appal the young child.
meanings.sent2: The gruesome scene in the horror movie appalled the audience.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating bugs might appal some, but in other countries, it's a delicacy.
meanings.sent4: The level of pollution in the river would appal any environmentalist.
meanings.sent5: The sudden appearance of the ghost in the story appalled the readers.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel intense fear or disgust
meanings.sent1: The eerie silence in the haunted house appalled the visitors.
meanings.sent2: The rotten smell coming from the garbage can appalled the neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The thought of spiders crawling on her skin would appal Sarah.
meanings.sent4: The betrayal by his closest friend appalled him to the core.
meanings.sent5: The graphic details in the crime scene photos appalled the detective.
